nodes.documentation:
@title The fact of CryptoSneakers core contract that manages ownership, ERC-721 (draft compliant).
 @author Heriberto Prieto
nodes.name: SneakerOwnership
supportsInterface

nodes.documentation:
@dev Set the address of the sibling contract that tracks metadata.
  CEO only.
nodes.name: setMetadataAddress
_owns

attributes.documentation:
@title The fact of CryptoSneakers core contract that manages ownership, ERC-721 (draft compliant).
 @author Heriberto Prieto
attributes.name: SneakerOwnership
supportsInterface

attributes.documentation:
@dev Set the address of the sibling contract that tracks metadata.
  CEO only.
attributes.name: setMetadataAddress
_owns

devdoc.author: Heriberto Prieto

_owns(address,uint256).details: Checks if a given address is the current owner of a particular Sneaker.

params._claimant: The address we are validating against.

pause().details: Called by any "C-Level" role to pause the contract. Used only when  a bug or exploited is detected and we need to limit damage.

setCEO(address).details: Assigns a new address to act as the CEO. Only available to the current CEO.

params._newCEO: The address of the new CEO.

setCFO(address).details: Assigns a new address to act as the CFO. Only available to the current CEO.

params._newCFO: The address of the new CFO.

setCOO(address).details: Assigns a new address to act as the COO. Only available to the current CEO.

params._newCOO: The address of the new COO.

setMetadataAddress(address).details: Set the address of the sibling contract that tracks metadata.  CEO only.

unpause().details: Unpauses the smart contract. Can only be called by the CEO, since  one reason we may pause the contract is when CFO or COO accounts are  compromised.

devdoc.title: The fact of CryptoSneakers core contract that manages ownership, ERC-721 (draft compliant).

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Introspection interface as per ERC-165  Returns true for any standardized interfaces implemented by this contract. We implement  ERC0165 (obviously!) and ERC-721;

unpause().notice: This is public rather than external so it can be called by  derived contracts.
